page.title: 06Lowtown Area
page.content: To the north of the museum the land in squares 92/72,73,74,75 is divided up into part of the Lowtown area of Bridgnorth and mainly agricultural land. In squares 92/75 lies the Queens Parlor, a large outcrop of sandstone topped by trees many years old. The tall trees cast dark shadows across the fresh green grass which covers the damp earth and creeps to the edge of the steep red rock. They are peering slightly over the side,watching bracken far below as it spreads across the field and reaches the town which stretches into the distance far away. These houses are all new, not like the old black and white houses in the area around the river's edge.There is a maze of roads between the Wolverhampton and Stourbridge main roads.
